title: trace api failed with nonce too low
body:
i firstly run erigon node without  assign --http.api option, the erigon --help don't show more options

when i call trace api, it return the method not supported

so, i stop the node (it alreay sync 9 million blocks) and restart with --http.api=eth,erigon,engine,debug,trace,txpool,net

the trace_api is return nonce too low error, the blockNumber is less than 9 million

how to fix ?

1. delete all data, and resync?
2. just wait erigon construct traces?
Hi @Matrix-Zhang please could you provide an example trace?

there is no --prune flags. below is my systemd service file
```
[Unit]
Description="erigon service"
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/bin/erigon --datadir=/home/ubuntu/ethereum/ --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.api=eth,erigon,engine,debug,trace,txpool,net
Restarts=always
User=ubuntu

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```
Then likely it’s real bug and need investiigate
@AskAlexSharov What can I do now ? resync or waiting your team fix it ?

> @AskAlexSharov What can I do now ? resync or waiting your team fix it ?

we don't know reason now - so, we don't know will resync help or not

command ： nohup /root/erigon/build/bin/erigon --datadir=/mnt/erigon_data --chain=mainnet --port=30303 --http.port=8545 --authrpc.port=8551 --torrent.port=42069 --torrent.download.rate=20mb --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9090 --http --ws --http.api=eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon &

curl command: curl -s --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"debug_traceTransaction","params":["0x438b768cf4c9d20520ed69f1cecde7e8dee8d89a2e68faefbf10a9ce97360537"],"id":"1"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST http://localhost:8545

error info ： {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":"1","result":nullnull,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"transaction 6b1b32e2377d6570218fcc94284f3ab10c73d19ea3a7ca10b7bd710011511e9d failed: nonce too low: address 0x67EBc532d648E6164a6fd726ff0b39e69180DAFE, tx: 1576 state: 7841"}}

[Looking forward to your reply](javascript:;)
@alpinechipmunk I can make that curl call successfully on my erigon instance, so perhaps the data in your instance is corrupted. I am running v2.37.0 on this instance.

I have a feeling this is related to pruning, putting some code in to confirm if this is the case or not.  When the code tries to retrieve the state for an account at a point in time it comes back with what looks like a corrupted key, which is either actual corruption or pruned data.  Further up the stack we see this error and load the current account state instead, hence the "nonce too low" problem.

Hi @Matrix-Zhang, @alpinechipmunk, @keithchew.

An update on this one.  I can run all of those RPC calls with no problem on a live archival node.  They all return data fine when not using the debug calls, instead using trace_block and trace_transaction (debug calls aren't enabled on the node).  Could you confirm if this is the case for your calls as well, do they work in their non-debug calls?

If they still return these errors around nonce values then it means either a) pruning is in effect and these blocks have their history removed or b) the datadir is corrupt in some way and you'll need to re-sync.

I have a PR open to help with problem a above.  There will be a quick check on trace calls to see if the block in question has had its history pruned or not and will just return early stating so, this will likely help prove off if the issue is around pruning or not when it makes it into a release.
@Matrix-Zhang, @alpinechipmunk, @keithchew - has anybody had chance to check this with the latest release to see if the pruning check in the code is showing pruned data?

> @Matrix-Zhang, @alpinechipmunk, @keithchew - has anybody had chance to check this with the latest release to see if the pruning check in the code is showing pruned data?

i just change to reth client now.....
